skill.name: when-optimizing-prompts-use-prompt-optimization-analyzer
skill.description: Active diagnostic tool for analyzing prompt quality, detecting anti-patterns, identifying token waste, and providing optimization recommendations
skill.summary: Active diagnostic tool for analyzing prompt quality, detecting anti-patterns, identifying token wast...
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure prompt-based analysis tool with no code execution, network access, or file system operations. It contains only embedded JavaScript examples for illustration purposes and does not execute any external code. The skill is safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Wasting tokens on verbose prompts? Our analyzer detects redundancy, anti-patterns, and optimization opportunities. Get specific recommendations to reduce token usage by 20-50% while improving clarity.
actual_capabilities: Detects token waste through redundancy analysis
limitations: Analysis based on pattern matching, not semantic understanding
Cannot optimize prompts with domain-specific requirements
May not detect all edge cases in complex prompts

use_cases.title: Pre-publish Prompt Optimization
use_cases.description: Analyze and optimize prompts before publishing new AI tools or skills to reduce token costs and improve performance.

use_cases.title: Library-wide Optimization
use_cases.description: Systematically analyze entire prompt libraries to identify common anti-patterns and standardize quality.

use_cases.title: Budget-Conscious Development
use_cases.description: Optimize prompts when hitting token limits or experiencing inconsistent AI responses due to unclear instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this prompt for optimization opportunities: [paste prompt]

prompt_templates.title: Deep Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform full prompt optimization analysis including token waste, anti-patterns, and trigger clarity for: [prompt]

prompt_templates.title: Specific Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Focus on [redundancy|clarity|structure] optimization for this prompt: [prompt]

prompt_templates.title: Comparative Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze and compare these prompt versions for optimization: [prompt1] vs [prompt2]

output_examples.input: You are a code reviewer. Your job is to review code and make sure it's good. You should look at the code and find problems.
output: Optimized version: 'You are a code reviewer analyzing pull requests for quality and correctness. Review Process: 1. Scan for logic errors, null checks, edge cases 2. Verify style compliance'

best_practices: Run analysis before publishing any new prompts or skills
Focus on high-severity issues first for maximum impact
Keep optimization reports for tracking improvements over time
anti_patterns: Ignoring medium/low severity issues - they compound over time
Over-optimizing to the point of losing important context
Applying recommendations blindly without testing changes

faq.question: Is this compatible with all AI platforms?
faq.answer: Yes, the analyzer works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It analyzes prompts at the text level regardless of target platform.

faq.question: What are the token reduction limits?
faq.answer: Typical reductions range 20-50%. The analyzer preserves essential meaning while removing redundancy and improving clarity.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my development workflow?
faq.answer: Yes, use pre-task hooks to analyze prompts before publishing skills. Store optimization metrics in memory for tracking.

faq.question: Is my prompt data safe during analysis?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a local analysis tool. No prompts are sent to external services - all processing happens within your Claude Code environment.

faq.question: What if the optimization breaks my prompt?
faq.answer: The analyzer provides recommendations, not automatic changes. Review and test all optimizations before implementing them.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual prompt review?
faq.answer: The analyzer systematically checks for 15+ common issues and provides quantitative metrics, making optimization faster and more thorough than manual review.
